roleset.name: be social, be exposed to people; be social
roleset.note: SOCIALIZE-V NOTES: Based on sentences in wsj. No VNcls. (from socialize.01-v)
SOCIALIZATION-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to socialize.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie (from socialization.01-n)

example.name: socialize-v: schmooze
example.text: [The gruff financier]-1 recently started *trace*-1 socializing in upper-class circles.

example.name: socialization-n: group being taught social customs
socialization-n: also the group interacting with itself

roleset.name: put into socialist system
roleset.note: SOCIALIZATION-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to socialize.02. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie (from socialization.02-n)

example.name: socialize-v: viva la revolucion!
example.text: Carl Schramm, president of the Health Insurance Association of America, scoffs at ``capitalists who-1 [*trace*-1]-2 want *trace*-2 to socialize the entire financing system'' for health.
example.arg: the entire financing system'' for health

example.name: socialization-n: public and service may appear on two lines requireing concatanation or on one

roleset.name: living/being in the company of others
roleset.note: SOCIAL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. Relation to socialize.01. (from social.01-j)

example.name: social-j
example.text: my girl is very social and loves the company of other kids but she can be overbearing at times.
